reasoning: Cross-cutting UI change affecting 20-30+ components. While TailwindCSS exists, comprehensive mobile-responsive patterns need to be established. High risk of breaking existing desktop functionality. Requires research for touch optimization and mobile performance best practices.

scope.notes: Every UI component needs mobile optimization: scorer (5 components), templates (4 components), analytics (3 components), AI (1 component), layout (2 components), UI primitives (13 components). This is a cross-cutting change affecting the entire frontend.

integrations.notes: No external services, but research needed for mobile UX best practices: touch target sizes (44px minimum), mobile viewport optimization, touch gesture handling, mobile performance patterns (lazy loading, code splitting), responsive breakpoint strategies.

infrastructure.notes: Frontend-only change. No infrastructure modifications needed. TailwindCSS v4 already configured.

knowledge.notes: TailwindCSS responsive utilities exist and some components already use them (lg:grid-cols-2). However, comprehensive mobile-first responsive design pattern is not established. Need research for: touch-friendly UI patterns, mobile performance optimization, responsive component design, mobile testing strategies.

concerns: Touch vs mouse event handling inconsistencies
Viewport orientation edge cases (portrait vs landscape)
Font sizing and readability on mobile
risk.notes: High risk due to cross-cutting nature. Every component modification could potentially break existing desktop functionality. Need comprehensive testing across multiple viewport sizes and devices.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: High-risk cross-cutting UI change requires comprehensive validation. E2E tests needed to verify responsive behavior across multiple viewport sizes (mobile portrait/landscape, tablet, desktop). No security concerns as this is purely UI/UX changes with no auth or data handling modifications.
